articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Bier of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Bier of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea and supreme leader of the party, state and army, Tuesday visited again the bier of leader Kim Jong Il and expressed profound condolences.
					
					 Overcome with the bitterest grief, Kim Jong Un, together with senior officials of the party, state and armed forces organs, paid silent tribute to his bier, praying for his immortality, and looked round it. 
					
					  Standing vigil by the side of the bier, Kim Jong Un greeted people of different social standings including representatives of various provinces visiting there to express condolences over his demise. 
					
					 The hearts of the participants were filled with the firm resolution to unite closer around Kim Jong Un, great successor to the revolutionary cause of Juche and supreme leader of the party, state and army, and live and struggle as human beings of faith that they will believe and follow him only in any adversity. 
					
					 Among the mourners were senior officials of the party, state and armed forces organs Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Kyong Hui, Kim Yong Chun, Jon Pyong Ho, Kim Kuk Thae, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Yang Hyong Sop, Ri Yong Mu, O Kuk Ryol, Kang Sok Ju, Pyon Yong Rip, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Kim Yang Gon, Kim Yong Il, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Rak Hui, Thae Jong Su, Kim Phyong Hae, Mun Kyong Dok, Ju Kyu Chang, U Tong Chuk and Kim Chang Sop.

articles.title: KCNA Report
articles.content:
KCNA Report

					News Agency released the following report Tuesday:
					
					 At noon on December 29 when the national memorial service will be held for leader Kim Jong Il, gun volleys will be fired in Pyongyang and in provincial seats and all the people will observe three minutes' silence and all locomotives and ships (those on voyage included) will blow whistles and those units with sirens will sound them all at once.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets S. Korean Mourners' Groups
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets S. Korean Mourners' Groups

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday met and had a talk at the Mansudae Assembly Hall with Ri Hui Ho, widow of ex-President Kim Dae Jung, and Hyon Jong Un, chairwoman of Hyundai Group, and their parties of south Korea who came to Pyongyang to express deep condolences on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					Ri and Hyon expressed deep condolence over the death of    Kim Jong Il.
					
					   They hoped for the implementation of the June 15 joint declaration and October 4 declaration and expressed the willingness to carry them into practice.

articles.title: Ri Hui Ho and Hyon Jong Un of S. Korea Leave
articles.content:
Ri Hui Ho and Hyon Jong Un of S. Korea Leave

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Ri Hui Ho, widow of ex-President Kim Dae Jung, and Hyon Jong Un, chairwoman of Hyundai Group, and their parties of south Korea went back via Kaesong on Tuesday after visiting Pyongyang to express their deep condolences on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Chinese Officials Visit DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Chinese Officials Visit DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Dai Bingguo, state councilor of the People's Republic of China, and Liu Qi, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and secretary of the Beijing Municipal Committee of the CPC, Tuesday paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Beijing on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They were accompanied by Zai Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Chen Fengxiang, deputy head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., CPC, the permanent deputy mayor of the Beijing Municipal People's Government, Zhang Kunsheng, assistant to the foreign minister, and other officials concerned.
					
					 Wreaths were laid before the portrait of Kim Jong Il in the name of Dai Bingguo and Liu Qi and in the joint name of the Beijing Municipal Committee of the CPC and the Beijing Municipal People's Government.
					
					 The mourners bowed three times before the portrait of Kim Jong Il, expressing deep condolences.
					
					 Dai Bingguo with tears in his eyes recollected with deep emotion the days when he was received by Kim Jong Il on his visit to China in May, saying he could never forget the time when he met the leader and had cordial talks several times.
					
					 He said though Kim Jong Il passed away, he could never forget the tender-hearted leader.
					
					 He expressed belief the Korean people would convert sorrow into strength and register successes in all affairs under the leadership of Comrade Kim Jong Un, true to the behests of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Liu Qi said that Kim Jong Il performed historic feats for the party, state and people of the DPRK and made great contributions to boosting the traditional China-DPRK friendly relations, adding that the Chinese people will always remember him.

articles.title: Leading Officers of CPLA Visit DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Leading Officers of CPLA Visit DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Xu Caihou, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission, visited the DPRK embassy in Beijing on Dec. 27 to express condolences on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He was accompanied by Liang Guanglie, member of the Central Military Commission of China, state councilor and minister of National Defense, Li Jinai, member of the Central Military Commission of the CPC and director of the General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, Ma Xiaotian, deputy chief of General Staff of the CPLA, and Qian Lihua, director of the Foreign Affairs Office of the Ministry of National Defense, and others.
					
					 Wreaths were laid before the portrait of Kim Jong Il in the name of the Central Military Commission of China, the Ministry of National Defense, the General Staff, the General Political Department, the General Logistics Department, the General Armament Department, the navy and air force of the CPLA.
					
					 They bowed three times before the portrait of Kim Jong Il, expressing profound condolences.
					
					   Xu Caihou did not keep back his sorrow over the demise of Kim Jong Il.
					
					  He expressed the most profound and sincere condolences to the Korean people and the officers and men of the Korean People's Army on behalf of all officers and men of the CPLA. He added: 
					
					 Comrade Kim Jong Il was the great leader of the party, state and army of the DPRK and a close friend of the Chinese people and army.
					
					 The Chinese people and army will always remember him.
					
					 The CPLA will, together with the KPA, make positive efforts to consolidate and develop the traditional friendly and cooperative ties between the two countries and armies and defend the peace and security of the region and the world, true to the noble intentions of the top leaders of the two countries in the future, too.

articles.title: Condolatory Messages from King of Bahrain
articles.content:
Condolatory Messages from King of Bahrain

					Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a message of condolences from Sheikh Hamad Bin Isa al-Khalifa, king of Bahrain, on December 25.
					
					The king in the message expressed his sincere condolences and sympathy to Kim Jong Un on the demise of Kim Jong Il, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission. 
					
					He hoped Kim Jong Un would overcome the sorrow to remain in good health and he and the friendly Korean people would enjoy happiness.

articles.title: Condolatory Messages from Congolese President
articles.content:
Condolatory Messages from Congolese President

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a condolatory message from Congolese President Denis Sassou-Nguesso on Dec. 21.
					
					 He in the message said he learnt in a great shock the news that Chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il passed away to his regret.
					
					 The message said mourning with Kim Jong Un, he, on behalf of the people and the government of Congo and on his own, expresses deepest condolences to him and the friendly Korean people.
					
					 Mourning the demise of outstanding man Kim Jong Il in humble reverence, the message expressed deep sympathy to Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Condolatory Messages from Mongolian Party Official
articles.content:
Condolatory Messages from Mongolian Party Official

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a message of condolences from M. Enkhsaihan, chairman of the National Democratic Party of Mongolia, on Dec. 22.
					
					 The message expressed deep condolences over the demise of Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and dear leader of the Korean People.
					
					 It said that Kim Jong Il devoted all his life to the people's happiness and he will live forever in the hearts of not only the Korean people but all the people supporting and respecting his cause.
					
					 It expressed profound gratitude to Kim Jong Il for the concern he had shown for the development of the friendly and cooperative relations between Mongolia and the DPRK.

articles.title: Condolatory Messages from Palestinian Party Leader
articles.content:
Condolatory Messages from Palestinian Party Leader

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a message of condolences from Khalid Abdul Majid, general secretary of the Palestinian Popular Struggle Front, on Dec. 22.
					
					 I, on behalf of the Central Committee of the Palestinian Popular Struggle Front and on my own, express deepest condolences to Comrade Kim Jong Un on the passing away of the great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il in the crucial period of showdown with the U.S. imperialists, the general secretary said in the message.
					
					 We are sure that you will inherit the cause of Kim Jong Il and achieve successes in wisely leading the Workers' Party and people of Korea in the wake of the great leaders, he stressed.

articles.title: Condolatory Messages from Canadian Party Leader
articles.content:
Condolatory Messages from Canadian Party Leader

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a message of condolences on Dec. 21 from Sandra Smith, national leader of the C.C., Communist Party of Canada (Marxist-Leninist). 
					
					 The message said:
					
					 On behalf of all members and supporters of the Communist Party of Canada (Marxist-Leninist) and on my own behalf, I express heartfelt condolences on the untimely passing of Comrade Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army. 
					
					 He is greatly admired by all revolutionary forces for working tirelessly for the peaceful independent reunification of Korea, upholding the dignity and honor of the Korean nation, and securing peace on the Korean Peninsula on the basis of the Songun military first policy, thus contributing greatly to world peace. 
					
					 We are confident that the Korean communists and people led by the WPK and united around you as supreme leader, will turn their grief into strength and face all the challenges which lie ahead by marching together to ever greater victories on the road of independence, national reunification, socialism and peace.

articles.title: Condolatory Messages from Egypt's Party Leader
articles.content:
Condolatory Messages from Egypt's Party Leader

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a message of condolences from Sayed Abdul Al, general secretary of the National Progressive Unionist Party of Egypt, on Dec 22.
					
					 The untimely demise of leader Kim Jong Il is a shock to the party and all the people aspiring after socialism, the message said.
					
					 It expressed condolences to Kim Jong Un, the great Korean people and the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea on behalf of leader Khaled Mohieddin, Chairman Dr. Rifat Es-Said, leading members of the Central Committee and members of the National Progressive Unionist Party of Egypt.

articles.title: Condolatory Messages from Party Leaders of Argentina, Peru
articles.content:
Condolatory Messages from Party Leaders of Argentina, Peru

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received condolence messages from Jorge Pereyra, general secretary of the Extraordinary Congress Communist Party of Argentina, and Victor Oliva Miguel, general secretary of the Revolutionary Socialist Party of Peru, on Dec. 20 and 22.
					
					 The messages said the passing of leader Kim Jong Il is a bitter sorrow to the peoples struggling for peace and sovereignty against imperialism, expressing deep condolences on his demise.

articles.title: Condolatory Messages from Italian Party Leader
articles.content:
Condolatory Messages from Italian Party Leader

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un on Dec. 19 received a condolence message from Marco Rizzo, general secretary of the Leftwing People's Party of Communists of Italy, on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The message said:
					
					 It is with sadness that I learned of the untimely passing of Comrade Kim Jong Il, the outstanding leader of the revolutionary cause of Juche, the Workers' Party of Korea, the DPRK and the Korean people.
					
					 I, on behalf of all members of the party and Director of its International Department Alfonso Galdi, would like to express deepest sympathy to Comrade Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Condolatory Messages from Congolese Socialist Party
articles.content:
Condolatory Messages from Congolese Socialist Party

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a condolatory message from the Central Committee of the Congolese Socialist Party on Dec. 22.
					
					 The message said:
					
					 On behalf of all members of the Congolese Socialist Party, its Central Committee expresses condolences to you on the sudden demise of Comrade Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the Korean people.
					
					 The members of the Congolese Socialist Party will continue their mourning until the day of the ceremony of bidding farewell to his bier.
					
					 The Congolese Socialist Party and all its members express solidarity with the courageous Korean people and are sharing sorrow with them.
					
					 They hope that you, the creditable successor to the great leader Kim Jong Il, will continue to advance the struggle for the country's reunification and peace and register big successes in leading the DPRK.

articles.title: Condolatory Messages from Foreign Political Figures
articles.content:
Condolatory Messages from Foreign Political Figures

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Condolence messages came to the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea from Khalid Hadadi, general secretary of C.C., the Lebanese Communist Party and Sh. Shabdolov, chairman of the Communist Party of Tajikistan, on Dec. 21. 
					
					 They in the messages expressed heartfelt condolences to the Korean people and the C.C., the WPK on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Condolatory Messages from Syrian Political Figure
articles.content:
Condolatory Messages from Syrian Political Figure

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- The deputy regional secretary of Syria's Baath Arab Socialist Party sent a message of condolences to the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea on Dec. 20 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Expressing deepest condolences on the demise of Kim Jong Il, the message said that the world movement for liberation and peace lost the most prominent fighter who had defended the people's right from highhanded practices and supremacy by the world imperialists.
					
					 The Baath Arab Socialist Party and the Syrian people are sharing the sorrow at the loss of the greatest person with the Korean people, it said, affirming the will to boost the ties of friendship and cooperation in the struggle to meet the challenge Syria and the DPRK are facing.

articles.title: Condolatory Messages from Italian Party Leaders
articles.content:
Condolatory Messages from Italian Party Leaders

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a joint condolence message from Oliviero Diliverto, general secretary of the Communist Party of Italy, and Fausto Sorini, member of the National Leadership and director of the International Department of the Party, on Dec. 20. 
					
					 In the message they expressed the most fraternal and sincere condolences to Kim Jong Un, saying that they remember the great feats Kim Jong Il performed in defending the sovereignty of the DPRK and the dignity of the nation. 
					
					 Each nation and country has always the right to defend its sovereignty and destiny, it said.

articles.title: Condolatory Messages from President of OCA
articles.content:
Condolatory Messages from President of OCA

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un on Dec. 22 received a message of condolences from Sheikh Ahmad Al Fahad Al Sabah, president of the Asian Olympic Council.
					
					 The president in the message expressed heartfelt condolence on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il of the DPRK.
					
					 The message hoped that Kim Jong Un will convert pain at the great loss into courage, praying Kim Jong Il's noble soul may rest in eternal peace.
					
					 The message expressed belief that the government and the people of the DPRK will continuously thrive under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The message affirmed the council's cooperation and support to the development of the sports of the DPRK, wishing Kim Jong Un great success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Wreath from Syrian President
articles.content:
Wreath from Syrian President

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Syrian President Bashar Al-Assad sent a wreath to the bier of leader Kim Jong Il to express deep condolences over his demise.
					
					 The wreath was laid before his bier at the Kumsusan Memorial Palace by Haissam Saad, charge d'affaires a.i. of the Syrian embassy here, today.

articles.title: Wreath from Vietnamese Party Leader
articles.content:
Wreath from Vietnamese Party Leader

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Nguyen Phu Trong, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam, sent a large wreath to the DPRK embassy in Hanoi over the passing away of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Authorized by the general secretary, Hoang Binh Quan, chairman of the Commission for External Affairs of the party Central Committee, Ho Mau Ngoat, assistant to the general secretary, and its other leadership members paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy and placed the large wreath before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and paid silent tribute to him on Dec. 25.
					
					 The chairman once again expressed the deepest condolences, hoping that the party and people of the DPRK would overcome bitter sorrow with strength and courage and register bigger successes in their drive to build a thriving nation.
					
					 They made entries in the mourners' book.

articles.title: Wreaths from Russia's Parties, Art Groups, Personages
articles.content:
Wreaths from Russia's Parties, Art Groups, Personages

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Wreaths in the names of political parties, art groups and personages of Russia were laid before the bier of leader Kim Jong Il at the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Tuesday to express their deep sympathy over his demise. 
					
					 They included the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, the Party for Peace and Unity of Russia, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union, the "Orchestra of the 21st Century", the Academy Ensemble of the Interior Unit of the Russian Ministry of Interior, the State Academic Igor Moiseyev Dance Company, the State Academy Beryozka Dancing Troupe of Russia Named after N. S. Nadezhdina.
					
					 Wreaths also came from Konstantin Borisovich Pulikovski, former presidential envoy to the Far East Region of the Russian Federation, and the president of the Russkiy Mir Foundation of Russia.

articles.title: Wreath from Benin Political Party
articles.content:
Wreath from Benin Political Party

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- The New-Emerging Forces Union of Benin sent a wreath to the bier of leader Kim Jong Il in deep mourning over his demise.
					
					 The wreath was laid before his bier at the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Monday.

articles.title: Wreath from Nigeria's Senior Party Official
articles.content:
Wreath from Nigeria's Senior Party Official

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Ex-President of Nigeria Olusegun Obasanjo, chairman of the Credit Committee of the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria, sent a wreath to the bier of leader Kim Jong Il, expressing deep sympathy over his demise. 
					
					 The wreath was laid before the bier of Kim Jong Il at the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Tuesday.

articles.title: Wreaths from Foreign Political Parties
articles.content:
Wreaths from Foreign Political Parties

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Wreaths came from political parties of different countries to express deep condolences on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They included the National Democratic Congress of Ghana, the Supreme Council of the Socialist Party of Romania, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Germany and the Central Committee of the Malaysian Chinese Association.
					
					 The wreaths were laid before the bier of Kim Jong Il in the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on December 27.

articles.title: Wreaths from Mongolian Organizations and Personage
articles.content:
Wreaths from Mongolian Organizations and Personage

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Wreaths came from the Mongolian organizations and a personage to mourn the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They are the Mongolian Committee for Mourning HE Kim Jong Il,  Kim Il Sung Class in Altanbulag County, Tov Province and Kim Jong Il Class in Gor KingÔºçErdene Institute of Teachers, Kim Jong Il Kindergarten and N. Batmonh, administrative governor of Altanbolag County, Tov Province. 
					
					 The wreaths were laid before the bier of Kim Jong Il at the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Tuesday.

articles.title: Wreaths from Foreign Organizations and Personages
articles.content:
Wreaths from Foreign Organizations and Personages

					 Pyongyang December 27 (KCNA) -- Organizations and personages of different countries sent wreaths to express deep condolences on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They included the Russian Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung, former Deputy President of the Nigerian Senate Ibrahim Mantu who is co-chairman of the International Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of the Great Leader President Kim Il Sung and the general director of a Malaysian sightseeing and tourism co., ltd.
					
					 The wreaths were laid before the bier of Kim Jong Il at the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Tuesday.

articles.title: Wreath from SG of Intl Kim Il Sung Prize Council
articles.content:
Wreath from SG of Intl Kim Il Sung Prize Council

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Vishwanath, secretary general of the International Kim Il Sung Prize Council and director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, sent a wreath expressing deep condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The wreath was laid before the bier of Kim Jong Il at the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Tuesday.

articles.title: Wreaths from Juche Idea Study Organizations
articles.content:
Wreaths from Juche Idea Study Organizations

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Juche idea study organizations in various countries and regions sent wreaths to express deep condolences on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They included the International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions, the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Hannover Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Germany and the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					
					 The wreaths were laid before the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il at Kim Il Sung Square on Tuesday.
					
					 Also placed there was a wreath from the Federal Republic of Germany-DPRK Association.

articles.title: Singaporean FM Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Singaporean FM Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Singaporean Foreign Minister K. Shanmugam paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Singapore on Dec. 23 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He observed a moment's silence before the portrait of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Expressing, on behalf of the Singaporean government and people, profound condolences on the demise of Kim Jong Il, he hoped that the Korean people would overcome the present bitter sorrow at the loss and register signal successes in the efforts to build a thriving country.

articles.title: Vietnamese Lawmakers Visit DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Vietnamese Lawmakers Visit DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- A mourners group of the Vietnamese National Assembly led by Vice-Chairman Uong Chu Luu paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Hanoi on December 24 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The group left a large wreath before his portrait and paid silent tribute to him.
					
					 The head of the group made an entry in the mourners' book:
					
					The demise of Kim Jong Il is an indescribable loss to the Korean people.
					
					  I, on behalf of the National Assembly and the people of Vietnam, express most heartfelt condolences to the Korean people.
					
					  I am sure that the Korean people would overcome sorrow and display strength and achieve greater victory in the cause of country's construction and progress.
					
					  Meanwhile, Vietnamese students who studied in the DPRK paid a condolatory visit to the embassy.

articles.title: More Foreign Party Leaders Visit DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
More Foreign Party Leaders Visit DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- More  foreign party leaders paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassies in their countries from Dec. 22 to 25 to mourn the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. Among them were Sujata Koirala, leader of the Nepal Congress Party and member of its Central Committee who is former vice prime minister and foreign minister of Nepal; Boswa Isekombe Sylvere, general secretary of the Communist Party of Democratic Congo, and its leadership members; and Fayez Shukri, Lebanese Regional secretary of the Arab Baath Socialist Party. 
					
					 They paid silent tribute to Kim Jong Il before his portrait, expressing deep condolences on his demise. 
					
					 Boswa Isekombe Sylvere wrote in the mourners' book that Kim Jong Il will live forever as their leader and his leadership will continue till victory in the anti-imperialist struggle. 
					
					 Fayez Shukri wrote that the demise of Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, is a big loss not only to the Korean people but also to the Lebanese people and other progressive people in the world as he devoted all his life to the cause of global independence, the socialist cause and the liberation of humankind.

articles.title: Personages of Different Countries Visit DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Personages of Different Countries Visit DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Personages of various countries paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassies between Dec. 20 and 23 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They included the foreign minister and the director general of the General Administration for  East Asia and Pacific of the Foreign Ministry of Pakistan, the chairman and leadership members of the Romanian Socialist Union, a delegation of the Democratic Party of Guinea led by the secretary for education, science and culture of the Party who is member of its National Political Bureau, Secretary General Riyad Chaloub and Director of Foreign Affairs Abdoulaye Diallo of the Ministry of Culture and Heritage of Guinea, the deputy general director of the government organ Horoya, Vice-President of Kindia University Boubakar Diakite, Director General of the Kim Il Sung Institute of Agricultural Science Secouna Camara and the vice-chairman of the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Association in Guinea and Chairman of the Guinea-Korea Friendship Association Banou Keita.
					
					 Among them were also the minister of Sports, the information secretary of the C.C., Communist Party, the vice-president and the international secretary of the Party for Free Motherland and the chairman of its Brasillia City Committee, and the director for East Asian Affairs and the acting chief of Protocol of the Foreign Ministry of Brazil.
					
					 In this period ambassadors and charges d'affaires a.i. of Russia, Myanmar, Nepal, Bangladesh, Philippines, Algeria and Kyrgyzstan to Pakistan paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy in Islamabad and the president of the World Peace Council paid condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Brazil.
					
					 They laid bouquets before the portraits of Kim Jong Il and paid a silent tribute to him.
					
					 Personages of the Amazonas and Miranda provincial committees of the Communist Party and the Central University of Venezuela on Dec. 22 visited the mourning center, set up at the building of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Venezuela, to express condolences.
					
					 Meanwhile the general manager of the Interpetrol Co., Ltd. sent a wreath to the mourning centre on Dec. 23.

articles.title: Foreign Personages Visit DPRK Missions
articles.content:
Foreign Personages Visit DPRK Missions

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Foreign personages of different social standings visited DPRK missions in their countries from Dec. 21 to 26 to express condolences on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. Among them were the deputy speaker of the People's Consultative Assembly of Indonesia, the general chairman and the general secretary of the National Guidance Council of the Pioneer Party of Indonesia, the chairman of the Advisory Council of the National Democratic Party of Indonesia, the vice-chairman of the Indonesian Chamber of Commerce and Industry, the representative of the Democratic Party of Thailand, the chairman of the Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand, the chairman of the Thailand-DPRK Friendship Association, leadership members of the Union Solidarity and Development Party, Union of Myanmar, the secretary general of the Olympic Committee of the Ministry of Sports of Myanmar, the first secretary of the Ministry of Fishery of Myanmar, the director of the Myanmar Medical Research Institute, the general director for affairs of East Asia and Pacific of the Bangladeshi Foreign Ministry, the general director of Cosmos Group, the director of the RB Power Company, the deputy general secretary of the National Council of the Communist Party of India, the chairman of the Indian Youth Group for the Study of Works of Comrade Kim Il Sung, the chairman of the Juche Idea Study Society of Delhi, India, the chairman of the Indian Intellectuals' Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, the president of the Indian Working Women Society for Study of the Juche Philosophy, the secretary general of the Lao State Football Federation, the chairman of the Traffic Security Council of Kuwait, the editor-in-chief of Kuwait Times and the rector of the College of Social Sciences of Kuwait University. 
					
					 The visitors laid wreaths, floral baskets and bouquets before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and paid silent tribute to him.

articles.title: Personages of Various Countries Visit DPRK Missions
articles.content:
Personages of Various Countries Visit DPRK Missions

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Personages of various countries called at the DPRK missions between Dec. 20 and 23 to express heartfelt sympathy over the passing of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They included those from the Socialist Party of Romania, the Communist Party of Germany, the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany, the Federal Republic of Germany-DPRK Association, the Ethiopian Ministry of Culture and Tourism, the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea, the Addis Ababa Youth Association of Ethiopia, the International Taekwon-Do Association in Ethiopia, Medical College of University of Addis Ababa, the Christian Democratic People's Party of Switzerland and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Ministry of Defence of Switzerland, the Sankt Poelten City Committee of the Social Democratic Party of Austria, the Austrian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the International Affairs Institute of Austria.
					
					 They laid wreaths, floral baskets and bouquets before portraits of Kim Jong Il and expressed deep condolences over his demise. 
					
					 The general secretary of the Socialist Party of Romania said the passing of Kim Jong Il was a great loss and sadness not only to Korean people but to the world progressives.
					
					 The party will always remember his great exploits and iron faith and pluck of never yielding to any power as they serve as nutritious element that instills confidence and courage into everybody aspiring after socialism, the general secretary added. 
					
					 The vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Germany and the international secretary of the Christian Democratic People's Party of Switzerland expressed their expectation that the Korean people would rise up to overcome sorrow and surely accomplish the cause of Kim Jong Il under the leadership of Comrade Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Many Foreigners Visit DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Many Foreigners Visit DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Personages of various circles of Uganda, Nigeria, Egypt, Ethiopia, Democratic Congo, Senegal, Equatorial Guinea, Namibia and Libya expressed condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They paid condolatory visits to the mourning stations arranged at the DPRK embassies in their capital cities and aid organizations from Dec. 21 to 24.
					
					 Among them were acting foreign minister and ministers of Security and Interior of Uganda, the national financial secretary of the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria, the secretary of the Chamberlain of the Presidency of Egypt and representative of the Minister of Justice of Ethiopia.
					
					 They laid wreaths, floral baskets and bunches of flowers before portraits of Kim Jong Il and paid silent tribute to him.
					
					 Meanwhile, diplomatic envoys of different countries visited the DPRK embassies in their capital cities to express profound condolences over his demise. Among them were diplomatic envoys of China, Cuba, Egypt, Brazil and Congo in Equatorial Guinea, those of Cuba, Zimbabwe, Botswana, Sudan, Libya, Senegal, Angola and Kenya in Ethiopia, and those of China, Cuba, Iran, Sweden, Congo, Gabon, Ghana and Nigeria in Democratic Congo.

articles.title: Koreans in China Visit DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Koreans in China Visit DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Koreans in China visited the DPRK embassy in Beijing to express condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They included Jo Yong Hwan, chairman of the Zhongnan Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China, and its vice-chairmen; Choe Su Jin, general manager of the Heilongjiang Provincial National Economic Development General Company; Choe Song Ae, director of the Beijing Paeksin Technological Development Investment Co. Ltd.; Pak Chol Su, president of the Korea Taepung International Investment Group; and other officials and members of the compatriots' organizations and corporations and their members, families, Kim Chol, chairman of the Association for the Study of Koryo Culture and Economy in Beijing, To Hui Jong, chairman of the Association of Korean Veteran Teachers in Beijing, and its members, family of Prof. Jong Ki Ryol of Qinghua University, and other compatriots.
					
					 They laid wreaths and bouquets before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and paid silent tribute to him.
					
					 They made entries in the mourners' book.
					
					 Expressing deep condolences over his demise, they wrote that they have never thought of the country without him.
					
					 Kim Jong Il will always live in the hearts of all Koreans, they stressed.

articles.title: Koreans in Germany Visit DPRK Mission
articles.content:
Koreans in Germany Visit DPRK Mission

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- The vice-chairman of the Society for Cooperation among Koreans in Germany and his party and members of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification paid condolatory visits to the DPRK mission in Berlin on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They left wreaths and bouquets before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and paid silent tribute to him. 
					
					 They made entries in the mourners' book.

articles.title: Groups of Overseas Compatriot Mourners Arrive
articles.content:
Groups of Overseas Compatriot Mourners Arrive

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Tae Chon, representative of the Society for Cooperation among Koreans in Germany, and a mourners' group of the Association of Koreans in Canada headed by Chairman Kim Su Hae arrived here on Tuesday to express deep condolences on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Also arriving here on the same day was a home-visiting group of students of Joson University under the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan led by Ri Jun Sik, head of a department.    Earlier, a similar group of the Federation of Koreans in Australia headed by Chairman Pak Yong Ha came here on Monday.

articles.title: People in DPRK Visit Bier of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
People in DPRK Visit Bier of Kim Jong Il

					of the Korean People's Army, officials of friendly parties, public organizations, ministries and national institutions and working people of the DPRK visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace Tuesday morning to pay respects to the bier of leader Kim Jong Il there.
					
					 Amid the playing of funeral music, wreaths were laid in the name of KPA units, the C.C., the Korean Social Democratic Party, the C.C., the Chondoist Chongu Party, the C.C., the Korean Christian Federation, the Ministry of Labor, Ministry of Finance, Ministry of Food Procurement and Administration, Bureau of Service for Overseas Compatriots, Central Information and Communications Centre, Central Committee of the Writers Union of Korea, State Symphony Orchestra, Pyongyang Kim Won Gyun Conservatory, Eastern Pyongyang Thermal-power Plant, Taedonggang TV Set Factory and others.
					
					 The mourners paid a silent tribute to Kim Jong Il, looking up to his venerable image.
					
					 They could hardly repress their bitter grief before his bier.
					
					 All of them hardened their iron faith and will to successfully carry to completion the Songun revolutionary cause of Juche and the cause of building a thriving socialist nation, closely rallied around Kim Jong Un, the supreme leader of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people.

articles.title: Foreign Diplomats Visit Bier of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Visit Bier of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Staff members of the Nigerian and UK embassies and missions of the UNDP, FAO and the United Nations Population Fund here paid condolences to the bier of leader Kim Jong Il on Tuesday. 
					
					 Amid the playing of solemn music, wreaths in the name of the Nigerian embassy and UNDP mission were laid before his bier.
					
					 They paid silent tribute to him and looked round his bier.
					
					 They made entries in the condolence book.

articles.title: Overseas Compatriots Visit Bier of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Overseas Compatriots Visit Bier of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Overseas compatriots paid respects to the bier of leader Kim Jong Il on Tuesday. 
					
					 They were the delegation of officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), the delegation of young officials of Chongryon, the delegation of officials of the Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan, the delegation of Chongryon educational officials, the delegation of persons of literature and arts and sportspersons of Chongryon and the visiting group of the Federation of Koreans in Australia and the chairperson of the Unity Association of Koreans in Kazakhstan.
					
					 Wreaths in the name of the Federation of Koreans in Australia and the Unity Association of Koreans in Kazakhstan were laid.
					
					 They paid silent tribute to him in humblest reverence and went round his bier.
					
					They made entries in the mourners' book.

articles.title: Hwang Hye Ro of S. Korea Visits Bier of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Hwang Hye Ro of S. Korea Visits Bier of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Hwang Hye Ro, co-representative of the Korea Solidarity for Independent Reunification and Democracy in south Korea, Tuesday paid respects to the bier of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Seen by the side of the bier at the Kumsusan Memorial Palace was a wreath from Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					
					 Hwang Hye Ro paid a silent tribute in humblest reverence to the bier of Kim Jong Il before viewing it. 
					
					 Hwang wrote in the condolence book that she prayed for the soul of Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il who devoted himself to national reconciliation, unity and reunification of the country.

articles.title: SG of IIJI Visits Bier of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
SG of IIJI Visits Bier of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Kenichi Ogami, secretary general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, expressed condolences before the bier of leader Kim Jong Il on Dec. 27.
					
					 Amid the playing of solemn music a wreath was placed in the name of the secretary general.
					
					 He paid a silent tribute to Kim Jong Il before his bier in humblest reverence and viewed the bier.
					
					 He made the following entry in the mourners' book:
					
					 We heard the sad news, too sudden and too unbelievable at a time when we are working hard to accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche which was glorified by great General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The adherents to the Juche idea in the world are overcome with bitter sorrow.
					
					 Though Kim Jong Il passed away, he will always live in our hearts.
					
					 We feel reassuring as we are under Kim Jong Un, successor to Kim Jong Il and leader of the Korean people.
					
					 We will as ever struggle to the last, holding Kim Jong Un in high esteem as the great leader guiding the revolutionary cause of Juche.

articles.title: Chinese in N. Hamgyong Province Mourn Kim Jong Il's Demise
articles.content:
Chinese in N. Hamgyong Province Mourn Kim Jong Il's Demise

					 Chongjin, December 27 (KCNA) -- Chinese in North Hamgyong Province, DPRK laid wreaths before the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il in Chongjin City on Tuesday, expressing deep condolences over his demise.
					
					 They laid the wreaths and paid silent tribute to leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Chinese Diplomats in Chongjin Leave Wreath
articles.content:
Chinese Diplomats in Chongjin Leave Wreath

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Staff members of the Chinese consulate general in Chongjin City, North Hamgyong Province of the DPRK on Tuesday laid a wreath before the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il in the city to express deep condolences on his demise.
					
					 They placed a wreath in the name of the consulate general and observed a moment's silence in memory of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Meanwhile, Chinese and Russian guests laid wreaths and bouquets before smiling Kim Jong Il's portrait in Rason City and paid a silent tribute to him.

articles.title: Chinese Pay Silent Tribute to Smiling Kim Jong Il's Portrait
articles.content:
Chinese Pay Silent Tribute to Smiling Kim Jong Il's Portrait

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- The family of Zhang Weihua, Chinese anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr, and the family of Zhou Wei, daughter of Zhou Baozhong related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, and their parties on Dec. 27 expressed condolences before the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il at Kim Il Sung Square.
					
					 They laid wreaths and bunches of flowers before the portrait and paid silent tribute to Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Mourners' Groups of Chongryon Present Wreath
articles.content:
Mourners' Groups of Chongryon Present Wreath

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Mourners' groups of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) laid a wreath before the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il at Kim Il Sung Square on Dec. 27.
					
					 They included the mourners' groups of officials of Chongryon, officials of new generation of Chongryon, the Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan, educational workers of Chongryon and persons of literature and arts and sportspersons of Chongryon.
					
					 A wreath was placed in the joint name of the mourners' groups.
					
					 The members of the groups paid silent tribute to Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Overseas Korean Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Overseas Korean Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Chan Song, chairman of the World Federation of Overseas Korean Economists, together with his family paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Moscow on Dec. 25 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He laid a wreath before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and observed a moment's silence.
					
					 Upon hearing the sad news of the demise of Kim Jong Il, overseas Koreans are in a bitter grief, he said, and went on:
					
					 There is no one such as respected General Kim Jong Il in the world.
					
					 He was a great man with gifted military stratagem, noble moral obligation and boundless love for the country and the people.
					
					 He remained most faithful to the cause of the great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung. That is why all the Korean people have acclaimed and absolutely supported him as the recognized leader of the party, the state and the people, holding him in high esteem as the sun of the nation and the great leader.
					
					 Comrade Kim Jong Il will be remembered by all Koreans as the greatest leader who devoted his whole life to the country and the people.

articles.title: Young Chongryon Officials Pledge Loyalty to Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
Young Chongryon Officials Pledge Loyalty to Kim Jong Un

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Cha Dol, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Youth League in Japan said it is unbelievable that they can no longer see Kim Jong Il, great teacher and benevolent father, when interviewed by KCNA on Dec. 27. He is heading the delegation of the officials of new generation of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) on a visit to the homeland to mourn the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Il was a symbol of the victory and glory of the country and the nation and Chongryon and compatriots in Japan, he said, and went on:
					
					 We, all youths of Chongryon, have entrusted our destiny to him.
					
					 We could have worked with confidence in an alien land as we had the mainstay.
					
					 Kim Jong Il led the youths of the rising generation to creditably carry forward the Chongryon's patriotic cause.
					
					 It was thanks to him that we have grown up to be the pillar of the movement of Koreans in Japan and the Koreans' community.
					
					 He was really a kind-hearted father who opened a rosy future for us.
					
					 We will never get disappointed before the tremendous loss and sorrow.
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un represents our destiny and future as he has thoroughly inherited the idea and cause of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The new generation of Chongryon will give a successful continuity to the patriotic cause of Chongryon under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Increasing Number of People Mourn Kim Jong Il's Demise
articles.content:
Increasing Number of People Mourn Kim Jong Il's Demise

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Since it was reported that leader Kim Jong Il passed away suddenly on Dec. 17, the number of people coming to mourning sites has increased day by day.  
					
					 Son Yong Guk, a 41-year-old worker of the Ryongsong Machine Complex in South Hamgyong Province, told KCNA:
					
					 "I stand guard of honor beside leader Kim Jong Il's huge picture every night after work. The leader highly appreciated what we had done and invited us to Pyongyang to enjoy a good time. And he entertained us to a banquet and drank a toast to us. How can I forget it? He will always be with us."
					
					 Jo Il Gwang, a 16-year-old student of Hero Munchon Secondary School in Kangwon Province, said:
					
					 "We had a happy time at a camp when leader Kim Jong Il was inspecting frontline units. He was really our father. I swear to become a solider faithfully upholding his Songun (military-first) revolutionary cause."
					
					Kim Ok Bi, a 100-year-old woman living in North Hwanghae Province who came to the mourning site with the help of her grandsons and great-grandsons, said:
					
					 "Some time ago leader Kim Jong Il sent a spread to me on my centenary birthday, wishing me longevity. He uninterruptedly made field guidance tours for the happiness of our people. How can I describe my grief?
					
					 I vowed in the mourning site to make all my family members remain faithful to respected Comrade Kim Jong Un."

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Devotes His Life to People, Always in Jacket
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Devotes His Life to People, Always in Jacket

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- In his huge pictures displayed in the mourning sites, leader Kim Jong Il wears plain jacket with a broad smile on his face.
					
					 The Korean people have got used to seeing their leader in jacket.
					
					He had usually put on jacket while inspecting army units and providing field guidance to industrial establishments and farms.
					
					 One day he told President Kim Il Sung that the Korean people had lived a happy life in suits and neckties as the President had spared no pain for the country and people, always wearing a close-buttoned jacket. He also said the Korean people had felt remorseful for seeing the President still wearing the jacket though he was over 72 years old.
					
					 Touched by what he said, the President said he still had many things to do for the people and that he had accustomed himself to the jacket.
					
					 Then Kim Jong Il said that he would put on jacket all his life in the place of the President and work hard for the people.
					
					 From that time on, leader Kim Jong Il had always put on the jacket and successfully carried forward the leadership of the President.
					
					 He is still in the jacket, encouraging the people to creditably accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche started in Mt. Paektu, true to the leadership of Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: S. Korean Newspaper Urges "Government" to Allow Mourning Visit
articles.content:
S. Korean Newspaper Urges "Government" to Allow Mourning Visit

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Jaju Minbo, an Internet newspaper of south Korea, Monday carried an article titled "In mourning for the demise of Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission".
					
					 It is elementary etiquette towards Chairman Kim Jong Il and the compatriots in the north and the friendly feeling of the world humankind that the whole world express condolences and regret on his demise, the article said, and went on:
					
					 However, the "government" in the south has not allowed mourning visits by nongovernmental organizations and personages but warned that it would take a legal action against those mourning over his demise. This is a declaration of war to the people and an act of blemishing the good manners and customs of the Korean nation and trampling down the elementary human obligation.
					
					 Though belatedly, it should allow the political parties, nongovernmental organizations and media persons to freely visit the north to express condolences and conduct coverage and ensure establishment of mourning stations for those who are unable to pay a condolatory visit.
					
					 All media services in the south will have to come out for coverage visit and the authorities should positively ensure it.
					
					 The call of condolences on the demise of Chairman Kim Jong Il will mark a significant occasion in warming up the frozen south-north relations, as a message to the north showing the will to implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, and it will undoubtedly serve as a guarantee for the peaceful reunification.

articles.title: Seoul University Side Accused of Its Unethical Action
articles.content:
Seoul University Side Accused of Its Unethical Action

					  Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Students of Seoul National University of south Korea held a press conference in protest against the university side's dismantlement of an incense-burning altar for mourning the passing of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The students of the University set up the incense-burning altar at the university students' hall on Monday. 
					
					 They displayed at the altar a photo of Kim Jong Il taken with ex-President of south Korea Kim Dae Jung during the historic summit in Pyongyang in June 2000.
					
					 They wished to mourn the demise of Kim Jong Il with great sadness over his untimely passing as he was father of the nation and lodestar of national reunification. 
					
					 But the university side let hooligans forcibly dismantle the altar.
					
					 They condemned this reckless action, holding it is an expression of elementary etiquette to set up an incense-burning altar and express condolences.

articles.title: Events Held in Ibaraki Koreans in Japan
articles.content:
Events Held in Ibaraki Koreans in Japan

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Events took place at regional headquarters and branches of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) in different parts of Japan to mourn the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Memorial services were held by Chongryon regional headquarters in Tokyo Metropolis, Hokkaido, Hyogo and Saitama prefectures and by its West Ikuno, Osaka Prefecture, branch, Adachi, Tokyo Metropolis, branch and Seibu branch under the Chiba Prefectural Headquarters. 
					
					 At the services Chongryon officials and compatriots paid a silent tribute to the memory of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The participants recalled with deep emotion the great life of Kim Jong Il who devoted his all to the development of Chongryon, a precious patriotic legacy of President Kim Il Sung, and the movement of Koreans in Japan and the accomplishment of the revolutionary cause of Juche. 
					
					 They made their firm resolution to turn their sorrow into strength and courage and open up a new heyday of the movement of Koreans in Japan, true to the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, great successor to the revolutionary cause of Juche, as wished by Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Mourning Ceremony Held in Ibaraki
articles.content:
Mourning Ceremony Held in Ibaraki

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- A mourning ceremony for leader Kim Jong Il was held in the Hall of the Ibaraki Prefectural Headquarters of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) on Dec. 22.
					
					 Officials of the headquarters, compatriots and Japanese personages took part in the ceremony.
					
					 They presented bouquets before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and paid silent tribute to him.
					
					 Ri Yong Hun, chairman of the Headquarters, said officials of Chongryon and compatriots in Japan could not repress the profound sorrow over the untimely passing of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He referred to the immortal feats Kim Jong Il performed for carrying forward and accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche, achieving the prosperity of the socialist homeland and happiness of the people and developing the movement of Koreans in Japan.
					
					 We will certainly lay a springboard for ushering in fresh golden days of the movement of Koreans in Japan under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un who carries forward the intention of Kim Jong Il, he stressed.

articles.title: Memorial Service Held in Kyrgyzstan
articles.content:
Memorial Service Held in Kyrgyzstan

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- The United Confederation of Koreans in Kyrgyzstan held a memorial service on Dec. 23 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Present there were Chairman of the Confederation Pak Kyong Ho and its officials and compatriots.
					
					 They laid a wreath before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and paid silent tribute to him.
					
					 Upon hearing the sad news of the untimely demise of Kim Jong Il, officials of the Confederation and compatriots are paying tribute to him in the bitterest grief, Pak Kyong Ho said, and went on:
					
					 The demise of Kim Jong Il is an irretrievable great loss to the DPRK and the whole world.
					
					 We mourn with the people in the homeland.
					
					 The undying feats of Kim Jong Il who devoted all his energies to building a thriving nation true to the behests of President Kim Il Sung will shine forever.
					
					 The behests of Kim Jong Il will be successfully realized thanks to the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Foreign Organization and Personages Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreign Organization and Personages Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- The Youth League of the African National Congress of South Africa issued a statement on Dec. 22 and Hasanul Huq Inu, chairman of the Central Executive Committee of the Bangladesh National Socialist Party, and personages of Ecuador released statements on Dec. 21 and 22 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Youth League in its statement said that the DPRK turned into a political and ideological power, a military power and a scientific and technological power under the wise guidance of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 His immortal soul will always inspire the Korean people in invariably holding aloft the banner of Songun, the statement noted.
					
					 Hasanul Huq Inu in his statement lauded Kim Jong Il as a prominent thinker and theoretician who led the WPK and the army and people of the DPRK along the road of steady victories with his profound ideas and theories and extraordinary leadership, as he was possessed of all aspects of personality and qualifications on the highest level as a great man. 
					
					 Julio Ballesteros Espin, chairman of the Ecuador-Guaranda Institute for Friendship and Cultural Solidarity with the Korean People, said the demise of Kim Jong Il, the most outstanding statesman of the 21st century and guardian of socialism, is an irrevocable loss to the socialists and progressive people in the world. 
					
					Though Kim Jong Il passed away, the feats performed by him for the Korean revolution and the world socialism will always be remembered by humankind, he stressed.
					
					 The chairman of the committee of supporters for the government of Pichincha Province in Ecuador expressed conviction that the Korean people would overcome the present sorrow with courage and successfully carry forward the noble intention of Kim Jong Il, true to the leadership of Kim Jong Un, their supreme leader.

articles.title: Demise of Kim Jong Il Mourned in Nepal and Britain
articles.content:
Demise of Kim Jong Il Mourned in Nepal and Britain

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Nepali political party and personages and British organizations issued statements on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Central Committee of the Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist) in a statement on December 21 noted Kim Jong Il was a prominent leader of the socialist movement and the kind-hearted father of the people.
					
					 General Secretary Rambahadur Thafa and Vice-President Mohan Vaidyo of its Central Committee in a joint statement on Dec. 22 hoped that the Workers' Party of Korea would defend the sovereignty of the nation and build a thriving country and boost solidarity with the world progressive people along the road indicated by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Stoke-on-Trent Branch of the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in a statement on December 21 noted it would make positive efforts for eternally glorifying the noble life and feats of Kim Jong Il, intensifying the study and dissemination of the Juche idea and promoting friendship with the Korean people.
					
					 The British Branch of Korean Friendship Association in a statement on the same day expressed conviction that though Kim Jong Il demised to everybody's regret, the Korean people would overcome the present sorrow with strength and courage and more dynamically advance for the accomplishment of the revolutionary cause of Juche under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Papers of Nepal and Bangladesh Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Papers of Nepal and Bangladesh Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Papers of Nepal and Bangladesh carried special write-ups on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Nepali paper Arpan on December 23 carried an article titled "The demise of Kim Jong Il, sorrow to the world" illustrated with his portrait. It said Kim Jong Il was the great leader not only of the Korean people but of progressive humankind.
					
					 He performed undying feats for the socialist cause through his energetic ideological and theoretical activities and leadership, it stressed.
					
					 The Bangladeshi paper Blits on December 20 edited several articles illustrated with a portrait of Kim Jong Il and photos on his revolutionary activities.
					
					 The paper in an article titled "The ceaseless forced march made by Kim Jong Il with love for people" noted leader Kim Jong Il always shared sweets and bitters with the people, valuing and loving them most in the whole period of his protracted revolutionary leadership

articles.title: Foreign Personages Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreign Personages Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Personages of Russia, Nepal and Peru contributed  articles to media on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Oleg Kozhemyako, governor of Amur Region of Russia, in an article titled "Condolences on the demise of Kim Jong Il" posted on an Internet homepage on Dec 20, noted Kim Jong Il made a great contribution to the development of the cooperation between Russia and the DPRK.
					
					 Recollecting the days when he had the honor of being received by Kim Jong Il several times in the past, he introduced his enchanting personality.
					
					 Manju Ratna Sakya, chairwoman of the Nepal Journalist Association in an article contributed to the Dec. 23 issue of the Nepali paper Arpan said that the demise of Kim Jong Il is the greatest loss to the Korean people and great sorrow and pain to progressive humankind.
					
					 The appearance of the Korean people stricken with grief and sorrow clearly shows what great feats he performed for the country's prosperity and people's happiness, the article noted.
					
					 Yuri Castro Romero, secretary general of the Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship, in an article he posted on its Internet homepage on Dec. 20, praised the undying feats performed by Kim Jong Il before the era and history.

articles.title: Foreign Personages and Regional Organization Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreign Personages and Regional Organization Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Personages of various countries and a regional organization issued statements between Dec. 20 and 22 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The chairman of the General Union of Syrian Peasants in a statement expressed most profound condolences over the demise of Kim Jong Il and hoped that the relations between the peasants' unions of the two countries would steadily grow stronger.
					
					 The chairperson of the General Federation of Syrian Women said Kim Jong Il led the struggle against imperialism to victory, making an undying contribution to socialism, and steered the DPRK to prosperity.
					
					 Zaher al Khatib, secretary general of the Lebanon Federation of Workers, said the WPK and the Korean people would certainly overcome grief over the loss of their leader under Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 The president of the International Taekwon-Do Association in Ethiopia said that Kim Jong Il paid deep attention to the development of the friendly relations between the Ethiopian people and the Korean people in his lifetime.
					
					 The Secretary General of the Arab Union of Peasants praised Kim Jong Il as a great leader who devoted all his life to the progress and prosperity of the Korean people and rendered assistance, material and moral, to Arab countries, indicating the road of victory in the struggle against imperialism and Zionism.

articles.title: Foreign Party and Organizations Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreign Party and Organizations Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Brazilian Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist) and organizations of Nigeria and Nepal issued statements on Dec. 19 and 22 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The C.C., Brazilian Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist) said in its statement that Kim Jong Il would always be with all the Korean people dynamically advancing along the road of justice for sovereignty, independence and socialism.
					
					 The Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association in its statement noted that he made undying contributions not only to the building of a thriving nation in the DPRK but to the international common cause of global peace and stability.
					
					 The statement extended encouragement and solidarity to the Korean people, stating that the association would set the mourning period from Dec. 22 to 29.
					
					 The Nepal Journalist Association and the Nepal Journalist Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Politics in their joint statement stressed that the exploits of Kim Jong Il would shine long in the world history as he made undying contributions to the great development and prosperity of the DPRK, peace of the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world and the cause of realizing independence of the world's oppressed masses.

articles.title: Memorial Services Held in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Memorial Services Held in Foreign Countries

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Memorial services were held in UK, Belarus, Mexico and Switzerland on Dec. 23 and 24 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They were attended by personages of political parties and organizations and masses of those countries.
					
					  The participants paid silent tribute to Kim Jong Il.
					
					The chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist) said in his memorial speech that his demise is a greatest loss and sorrow not only to all the Koreans but to progressive mankind struggling against imperialism.
					
					 Jesus Antonio Carlos Hernandez, general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, noted in his memorial address that Kim Jong Il led the Korean and world revolution to victory for years, performing immortal exploits.
					
					  Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, said his lofty and august name and feats would always remain shining along with history and will be remembered by the world people forever.
					
					 A memorial service was held prior to the opening of the 28th "Golden Circus" International Circus Festival at the Tendastresce Circus Theatre in Rome. The family of Humberto Ortiz, general manager of the Voluntad Publishing House of Ecuador, also held a memorial service.

articles.title: German Party Sets Mourning Period
articles.content:
German Party Sets Mourning Period

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Communist Party of Germany on Dec. 23 set a period for mourning the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It set the days from Dec. 23 to 27 as a mourning period and decided to hold memorial services for Kim Jong Il at its affiliated organizations in the period.
					
					 It also decided to hold a remembrance meeting at the first convention of its leadership next year, carry an article in the party organ and conduct various events including seminar on exploits at affiliated organizations of the party.

articles.title: Committees for Mourning Demise Formed in Mongolia and Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Committees for Mourning Demise Formed in Mongolia and Democratic Congo

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- The Mongolian Committee for mourning the demise of Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the Korean people, was inaugurated with due ceremony in Ulan Bator on December 23.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence to mourn the demise of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The ceremony introduced the brief history of the revolutionary activities of Kim Jong Il. Then, Ch. Surenjav, chairman of the Mongolia-Korea Friendship Society, referred to the immortal feats Kim Jong Il performed for the victory of the socialist cause and the accomplishment of the human cause of independence.
					
					 The ceremony made public a list of members of the mourning committee and an action plan.
					
					 The mourning committee was inaugurated in Democratic Congo on December 22 on the demise of Kim Jong Il.
					
					  Boswa Isekombe Sylvere, general secretary of the Communist Party of Democratic Congo, was elected chairman of the mourning committee.
					
					  The committee discussed and decided the action plan to be carried out during the mourning period until December 29 and decided to hold a memorial service in Kinshasa with the ceremony of bidding farewell to take place on Dec. 28 as an occasion.

articles.title: DPRK Socialist Constitution Provided by President Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
DPRK Socialist Constitution Provided by President Kim Il Sung

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- In the DPRK the history of the popular constitution began along with the founding of the republic by President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 He had the constitution drafted on the basis of the tradition of the people's government building and the ten-point programme of the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland provided by him in the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, as well as the achievements and experience gained in state building in the northern half of Korea after the country's liberation. 
					
					 After nationwide discussions on the constitution, he had it adopted at the 1st Session of the Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) in September Juche 37 (1948). 
					
					 Feeling the need for a new socialist constitution in the mid-1960s, the President had paid deep concern to drafting it from the beginning of the 1970s. 
					
					 He continued speculation even during his field guidance tours to clearly indicate ways for successfully drafting it.
					
					 When the draft was worked out on the basis of his idea of believing in the people as in Heaven, he distributed it to officials to study and convened a meeting to discuss it.
					
					 At the meeting he spent hours to give a detailed explanation of its contents and expressions. 
					
					 The draft reflected his strong, patriotic will to turn the country into a socialist power of Juche without fail. 
					
					 The President clarified the basic contents of the socialist constitution at the 1st Session of the 5th SPA. 
					
					 The socialist constitution was promulgated on December 27, 1972. 
					
					 The enactment of the most popular and revolutionary constitution based on the immortal Juche idea provided the Korean people with a legal guarantee and powerful legal mechanism for fully realizing independence. 
					
					 Later, the constitution was supplemented with new articles under the guidance of leader Kim Jong Il and adopted as Kim Il Sung Constitution codifying his idea and feats for state building at the 1st Session of the 10th SPA held in September 1998.

articles.title: Papers Call for Glorifying Kim Jong Il's Feats for Building Socialist Power
articles.content:
Papers Call for Glorifying Kim Jong Il's Feats for Building Socialist Power

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Papers of the DPRK Tuesday, in editorials dedicated to its Socialist Constitution Day, call on all the people to eternally glorify the feats performed by leader Kim Jong Il in building a socialist power. 
					
					 President Kim Il Sung enacted the Socialist Constitution on Dec. 27, Juche 61 (1972).
					
					 This provided a legal guarantee for steadily consolidating and developing Korean-style socialism and helped the Korean people dynamically advance the revolution and construction with the powerful weapon for prosperity of the Republic, Rodong Sinmun says, adding:
					
					 Kim Jong Il called the Socialist Constitution Kim Il Sung Constitution and made sure that the constitution specified Kim Il Sung as the eternal President of the DPRK. And he had energetically led the work to advance the revolution and construction only in keeping with the idea and intention of the President.
					
					 Under his leadership the revolutionary character of Korean-style socialism was reliably defended despite the severe ordeal and trials and the stirring reality was brought in which the ideals of the people are translated into practice.
					
					 Kim Jong Il formulated the Songun politics as the powerful political method under socialism and established the Korean-style state machinery with the National Defence Commission as its backbone.  Through their practical experience, the Korean army and people have keenly felt how just such steps were.
					
					 Now standing in the van of the Songun revolution is the dear respected Kim Jong Un who is identical to Kim Jong Il, the paper says, calling on all the people to accelerate the general onward march for prosperity of the country, closely rallied around him.
					
					 Minju Joson says that the socialist government of the DPRK will faithfully uphold the leadership of Kim Jong Un and defend and glorify forever Korean-style socialism, the biggest legacy based on patriotism of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Feats of Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Suk Lauded
articles.content:
Feats of Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Suk Lauded

					 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Media of various countries carried special write-ups on the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 94th anniversary of birth of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					
					 The December issue of the Chinese Hong Kong magazine International Relations devoted its four pages to an article illustrated with photos of Kim Jong Il acknowledging the cheers of military paraders and inspecting a unit of the KPA.
					
					  The magazine noted in an article Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the KPA was a historic event of great significance in defending and glorifying socialism. 
					
					 It recalled that Kim Jong Il developed the KPA into a matchless army and turned the DPRK into a military power which no one dares provoke, foiling the moves of the imperialist allied forces to stifle it under the uplifted banner of Songun.
					
					 Thanks to this powerful military capability the people of the DPRK have dynamically pushed forward the building of a thriving socialist nation despite the ceaseless challenges and military threats of the hostile forces including the U.S., it stressed.
					
					 The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted on its Internet homepage an article titled "Peerless woman commander" accompanied by photos of Kim Jong Suk on Dec. 23.
					
					 The life of Kim Jong Suk was the one of an outstanding woman revolutionary and a genuine patriot who devotedly defended the ideas and safety of President Kim Il Sung and dedicated herself to the bright future of the country and nation, it said.
					
					 The Cambodian paper Pracheachon on Dec. 22 carried a photo of the woman commander of Mt. Paektu and noted she is highly lauded not only by the Korean people but by the world people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un vuelve a visitar Palacio Memorial Kumsusan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un vuelve a visitar Palacio Memorial Kumsusan

articles.title: Publicada informacion de la ACNC
articles.content:
Publicada informacion de la ACNC

					Pyongyang, 27 de diciembre (ACNC) -- La Agencia Central de Noticias de Corea (ACNC) hizo publica este martes la siguiente informacion:
					
					A las doce en punto del dia 29 de diciembre cuando se iniciara el acto central de condolencias en memoria del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, se tiraran salvas en su honor en la ciudad de Pyongyang y todas las cabezas provinciales, guardaran tres minutos de silencio los habitantes de todo el pais y tocaran simultaneamente la sirena las locomotoras, las embarcaciones (incluyendo las en plena navegacion) y todas las demas unidades que puedan hacerlo.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con grupos surcoreanos de visita de condolencias
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con grupos surcoreanos de visita de condolencias

					Pyongyang, 27 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, departio este martes en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con Ri Hui Ho, viuda del ex presidente surcoreano Kim Dae Jung y su comitiva, y Hyon Jong Un, presidenta del Grupo Hyundai y su comitiva, que vinieron a esta capital para expresar sentidas condolencias por el fallecimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					En la ocasion, Ri Hui Ho y Hyon Jong Un expresaron el profundo pesame por el deceso del Dirigente.
					
					Esperamos que se ejecuten la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre, senalaron y manifestaron sus voluntades de esforzarse por este fin.

articles.title: Regresan grupos de visita de condolencias del Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Regresan grupos de visita de condolencias del Sur de Corea

					Pyongyang, 27 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Regresaron el dia 27 por la via de Kaesong Ri Hui Ho, viuda del ex presidente surcoreano Kim Dae Jung, y Hyon Jong Un, presidenta del Grupo Hyundai, y sus comitivas, que visitaron Pyongyang para expresar sentidas condolencias por el fallecimiento del Dirigente   Kim Jong Il.
